name: Spaghetti Carbonara
description: A classic Roman pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and pepper, known for its creamy texture without the use of cream.
steps: Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente.
Render pancetta in a pan until crispy.
Whisk eggs and Parmesan cheese together in a bowl.
Drain pasta and mix into the pan with pancetta, off the heat.
Quickly add egg and cheese mixture, stirring vigorously to create a creamy sauce.
Season with freshly cracked black pepper and serve immediately.
tips: Ensure the pasta is hot when adding the egg mixture to cook the eggs safely.
Serve immediately to prevent the sauce from becoming too thick.
Adjust the amount of cheese to taste.
